main event: Three 13-year-old boys spotted a round, red light in the sky over Long Beach, California on February 24, 1954.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a basketball and had a white light shining from one side.
The object stood still in the sky for 34 seconds before moving towards the north.
The boys were originally counting stars in the Big Dipper when they noticed the object.
The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes.
The reporting officer believed the boys may have actually seen an aircraft that appeared to be standing still.
sighted object: round, red light with a white light shining from one side
